# Introduction

Welcome to the **MATH/COSC 495** consulting course! To analyze the poultry litter data, we will use a modern data science stack. This tutorial will guide you through installing the necessary tools on your laptop.

<div class="note">
<strong>Before you begin:</strong> Ensure you have administrator/sudo privileges on your computer and a stable internet connection.
</div>

You will need to install four components:

1.  **R**: A statistical programming language.
2.  **Python**: A general-purpose programming language.
3.  **Quarto**: A scientific publishing system (for creating reports).
4.  **Positron**: A next-generation IDE for data science.

---

# Step 1: Install R

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">1</span> **Download R**

*   **Windows**: Download [R for Windows](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/).
*   **Mac**: Download [R for macOS](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/). (Choose the version matching your chip: Apple Silicon M1/M2/M3 or Intel).
*   **Linux**: Install via your package manager (e.g., `sudo apt install r-base`).
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">2</span> **Install**

Run the installer you downloaded. You can accept all default settings.
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">3</span> **Verify Installation**

Open a terminal (Command Prompt on Windows, Terminal on Mac/Linux) and type:
<code>R --version</code>

You should see output showing the R version number (e.g., "R version 4.3.2").
</div>

---

# Step 2: Install Python

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">1</span> **Download Python**

Go to [python.org/downloads](https://www.python.org/downloads/) and download the latest version (e.g., 3.12 or newer).
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">2</span> **Install**

**Crucial Step for Windows Users**: When the installer opens, check the box that says **"Add python.exe to PATH"** before clicking "Install Now".
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">3</span> **Verify Installation**

Open a terminal and type:
<code>python --version</code> or <code>python3 --version</code>

You should see output like "Python 3.12.0". If you get a "command not found" error on Windows, you may need to restart your computer for PATH changes to take effect.
</div>

---

# Step 3: Install Quarto

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">1</span> **Download Quarto**

Go to [quarto.org/docs/get-started](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) and download the CLI (Command Line Interface) installer for your OS.
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">2</span> **Install**

Run the installer. This will allow R and Python to communicate with the document rendering system.
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">3</span> **Verify Installation**

Open a terminal and type:
<code>quarto --version</code>

You should see output showing the Quarto version (e.g., "1.4.554").
</div>

---

# Step 4: Install Positron

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">1</span> **Download Positron**

Go to the [Positron GitHub Releases](https://github.com/posit-dev/positron/releases).
Look for the `Assets` section of the latest release.

*   **Windows**: `.msi` or `.exe` file.
*   **Mac**: `.dmg` file.
*   **Linux**: `.deb` or `.rpm` file.
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">2</span> **Install**

Install Positron just like any other application on your system.
</div>

<div class="step-box">
<span class="step-number">3</span> **Verify Installation**

Launch Positron from your applications menu or desktop. You should see a welcome screen with options to create a new file or open a folder.
</div>

---

# Step 5: Verify Installation

Open **Positron**. You should see a welcome screen.

<div class="tip">
<strong>Success Check:</strong>
Open the "Terminal" pane in Positron (at the bottom) and type:
<code>quarto check</code>

You should see output indicating that Quarto, R, and Python are all found and valid.
</div>
